signal.name: GtkDatabox::selection-canceled
signal.description: This signal is emitted after a right click outside a selection rectangle.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkDatabox widget which zoomed in or out.

signal.name: GtkDatabox::selection-changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the mouse is moved with the left button pressed (and the #GtkDatabox:enable-selection property is set). The corners of the selection rectangle are stored in @selection_values.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkDatabox widget in which the selection was changed.

parameter.name: selection_values
parameter.parameter_description: The corners of the selection rectangle.

signal.name: GtkDatabox::selection-finalized

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkDatabox widget in which the selection has been stopped.

parameter.name: selection_values
parameter.parameter_description: The corners of the selection rectangle.

signal.name: GtkDatabox::selection-started
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when the mouse is firstmoved with the left button pressed after the mouse-down (and the #GtkDatabox:enable-selection property is set). The corners of the selection rectangle are stored in @selection_values.
@see_also: #GtkDatabox::selection-changed

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkDatabox widget in which the selection has been started.

parameter.name: selection_values
parameter.parameter_description: The corners of the selection rectangle.

signal.name: GtkDatabox::zoomed
signal.description: This signal is emitted each time the zoom of the widget is changed, see for example gtk_databox_zoom_to_selection(), gtk_databox_set_visible_limits().

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkDatabox widget which zoomed in or out.

function.name: gtk_databox_auto_rescale
function.description:
This function is similar to gtk_databox_set_total_limits(). It sets the total limits to match the data extrema (see gtk_databox_calculate_extrema()). If you do not like data pixels exactly at the widget's border, you can add modify the limits using the border parameter: The limits are extended by @border*(max-min) if max!=min. If max==min, they are extended by @border*max (otherwise the data could not be scaled to the pixel realm).
After calling this function, x values grow from left to right, y values grow from bottom to top.

parameter.name: border
parameter.parameter_description: Relative border width (e.g. 0.1 means that the border on each side is 10% of the data area).

function.return: 0 on success, -1 if @box is no GtkDatabox widget, -2 if no datasets are available

function.name: gtk_databox_bars_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDataboxBars object which can be added to a #GtkDatabox widget

parameter.name: X
parameter.parameter_description: array of horizontal position values of markers

parameter.name: Y
parameter.parameter_description: array of vertical position values of markers

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: marker size or line width (depending on the @type)

function.name: gtk_databox_calculate_extrema
function.description: Determines the minimum and maximum x and y values of all #GtkDataboxGraph objects which have been added to the #GtkDatabox widget via gtk_databox_graph_add().

parameter.name: min_x
parameter.parameter_description: Will be filled with the lowest x value of all datasets

parameter.name: max_x
parameter.parameter_description: Will be filled with the highest x value of all datasets

parameter.name: min_y
parameter.parameter_description: Will be filled with the lowest y value of all datasets

parameter.name: max_y
parameter.parameter_description: Will be filled with the highest y value of all datasets

function.return: 0 on success, -1 if @box is no GtkDatabox widget, -2 if no datasets are available

function.name: gtk_databox_calculate_visible_limits
function.description: Calculates the visible limits based on the adjustment values and page sizes and calls gtk_databox_set_visible_limits();

function.name: gtk_databox_create_box_with_scrollbars_and_rulers
function.description:
This is a convenience function which creates a #GtkDatabox widget in a GtkTable widget optionally accompanied by scrollbars and rulers. You only have to fill in the data (gtk_databox_graph_add()) and adjust the limits (gtk_databox_set_total_limits() or gtk_databox_auto_rescale()).
@see_also: gtk_databox_new(), gtk_databox_set_adjustment_x(), gtk_databox_set_adjustment_y(), gtk_databox_set_ruler_x(), gtk_databox_set_ruler_y()

parameter.name: p_box
parameter.parameter_description: Will contain a pointer to a #GtkDatabox widget

parameter.name: p_table
parameter.parameter_description: Will contain a pointer to a #GtkTable widget

parameter.name: scrollbar_x
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to attach a horizontal scrollbar

parameter.name: scrollbar_y
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to attach a vertical scrollbar

parameter.name: ruler_x
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to attach a horizontal ruler

parameter.name: ruler_y
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to attach a vertical ruler

function.name: gtk_databox_cross_simple_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDataboxCrossSimple object which can be added to a #GtkDatabox widget as nice decoration for other graphs.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: marker size or line width (depending on the @type)

function.name: gtk_databox_get_adjustment_x
function.description: Getter function for the #GtkDatabox:adjustment-x property.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_adjustment_y
function.description: Getter function for the #GtkDatabox:adjustment-y property.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_backing_pixmap
function.description:
This function returns the pixmap which is used by @box and its #GtkDataboxGraph objects for drawing operations before copying the result to the screen.
The function is typically called by the #GtkDataboxGraph objects.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_enable_selection
function.description: Getter function for the #GtkDatabox:enable-selection property.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_enable_zoom
function.description: Getter function for the #GtkDatabox:enable-zoom property.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_ruler_x
function.description: Getter function for the #GtkDatabox:ruler-x property.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_ruler_y
function.description: Getter function for the #GtkDatabox:ruler-y property.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_scale_type_x
function.description: Getter function for the #GtkDatabox:scale-type-x property.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_scale_type_y
function.description: Getter function for the #GtkDatabox:scale-type-y property.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_total_limits
function.description: Gives the total limits (as set by gtk_databox_auto_rescale() or gtk_databox_set_total_limits()).

parameter.name: left
parameter.parameter_description: Space for total left value or #NULL

parameter.name: right
parameter.parameter_description: Space for total right value or #NULL

parameter.name: top
parameter.parameter_description: Space for total top value or #NULL

parameter.name: bottom
parameter.parameter_description: Space for total bottom value or #NULL

function.name: gtk_databox_get_type
function.description: Determines the #GType of the GtkDatabox widget type.
function.return: The #GType of the GtkDatabox widget type.

function.name: gtk_databox_get_visible_limits
function.description: Gives the current visible limits. These differ from those given by gtk_databox_get_total_limits() if you zoomed into the data for instance by gtk_databox_zoom_to_selection() or gtk_databox_set_visible_limits() (these values can be changed by scrolling, of course).

parameter.name: left
parameter.parameter_description: Space for visible left value or #NULL

parameter.name: right
parameter.parameter_description: Space for visible right value or #NULL

parameter.name: top
parameter.parameter_description: Space for visible top value or #NULL

parameter.name: bottom
parameter.parameter_description: Space for visible bottom value or #NULL

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_add
function.description:
Adds the @graph to the @box. The next time the @box is re-drawn, the graph will be shown.
It might be becessary to modify the total_limits in order for the graph to be displayed properly (see gtk_databox_set_total_limits()).

parameter.name: graph
parameter.parameter_description: A graph, e.g. a #GtkDataboxPoints or a #GtkDataboxGrid object

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_calculate_extrema
function.description: Virtual function which determines the minimum and maximum x and y values of the values of this #GtkDataboxGraph object if applicable (there are graphs which do not contain data).

parameter.name: min_x
parameter.parameter_description: Will be filled with the lowest x value of the dataset

parameter.name: max_x
parameter.parameter_description: Will be filled with the highest x value of the dataset

parameter.name: min_y
parameter.parameter_description: Will be filled with the lowest y value of the dataset

parameter.name: max_y
parameter.parameter_description: Will be filled with the highest y value of the dataset

function.return: 0 on success, -1 if no data is available,

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_create_gc
function.description:
Virtual function which creates a graphics context for the @graph.
Typically called by derived graph objects when the graphics context is needed for the first time.

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_draw
function.description:
Virtual function which draws the #GtkDataboxGraph on the drawing area of the GtkDatabox object.
Typically this function is called by #GtkDatabox objects.

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_get_color
function.description: Gets the current color of the graph elements (e.g. points).

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_get_gc
function.description: Gets the current graphics context of the graph.
function.return: The current graphics context of the graph.

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_get_hide
function.description: Gets the current "hide" status.
function.return: Whether the graph is hidden (true) or not (false).

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_get_size
function.description: Gets the size of the graph elements (e.g. the line width).

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_remove
function.description: Removes the @graph from the @box once. The next time the @box is re-drawn, the graph will not be shown (unless it was added more than once).

parameter.name: graph
parameter.parameter_description: A graph, e.g. a #GtkDataboxPoints or a #GtkDataboxGrid object

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_remove_all
function.description: Removes all graphs from the @box. The next time the @box is re-drawn, no graphs will be shown.

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_set_color
function.description: Sets the color which the #GtkDataboxGraph object is supposed to be using when drawing itself.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: Color which is to be used by the graph object

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_set_gc
function.description: Sets the graphics context which the #GtkDataboxGraph object is supposed to be using when drawing itself.

parameter.name: gc
parameter.parameter_description: Graphics contex for the graph object

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_set_hide
function.description: Hidden graphs are not shown, when the #GtkDatabox containing them is redrawn.

parameter.name: hide
parameter.parameter_description: Declares whether should be hidden (true) or not (false).

function.name: gtk_databox_graph_set_size
function.description: Sets the size (e.g. line width) which the #GtkDataboxGraph object is supposed to be using when drawing itself.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: Size of graph elements for the graph object

function.name: gtk_databox_grid_array_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDataboxGrid object which can be added to a #GtkDatabox widget as nice decoration for other graphs.

parameter.name: hlines
parameter.parameter_description: number of horizontal lines in the grid

parameter.name: vlines
parameter.parameter_description: number of vertical lines in the grid

parameter.name: hline_vals
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to an array of gfloat horizontal grid coordinate

parameter.name: vline_vals
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to an array of gfloat vertical grid coordinate

function.name: gtk_databox_grid_get_hlines
function.description: Gets the number of horizontal lines in the @grid.
function.return: Number of horizontal lines in the @grid.

function.name: gtk_databox_grid_get_vlines
function.description: Gets the number of vertical lines in the @grid.
function.return: Number of vertical lines in the @grid.

function.name: gtk_databox_grid_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDataboxGrid object which can be added to a #GtkDatabox widget as nice decoration for other graphs.

parameter.name: hlines
parameter.parameter_description: number of horizontal lines in the grid

parameter.name: vlines
parameter.parameter_description: number of vertical lines in the grid

function.name: gtk_databox_grid_set_hlines
function.description: Sets the number of horizontal lines in the @grid.

parameter.name: hlines
parameter.parameter_description: number of vertical lines in the grid

function.name: gtk_databox_grid_set_vlines
function.description: Sets the number of vertical lines in the @grid.

parameter.name: vlines
parameter.parameter_description: number of vertical lines in the grid

function.name: gtk_databox_lines_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDataboxLines object which can be added to a #GtkDatabox widget.

parameter.name: X
parameter.parameter_description: array of horizontal position values of markers

parameter.name: Y
parameter.parameter_description: array of vertical position values of markers

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: marker size or line width (depending on the @type)

function.name: gtk_databox_markers_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDataboxMarkers object which can be added to a #GtkDatabox widget as nice decoration for other graphs.

parameter.name: X
parameter.parameter_description: array of horizontal position values of markers

parameter.name: Y
parameter.parameter_description: array of vertical position values of markers

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: marker size or line width (depending on the @type)

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: type of markers (e.g. triangle or circle)

function.name: gtk_databox_markers_set_label
function.description: Sets a label for one of the markers.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: index within the array of X/Y values

parameter.name: label_position
parameter.parameter_description: position of the label relative to the marker

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: text to be displayed in the label

parameter.name: boxed
parameter.parameter_description: Whether the label is to be enclosed in a box (true) or not (false)

function.name: gtk_databox_markers_set_position
function.description: Sets a position for one of the markers.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: index within the array of X/Y values

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position of the marker (e.g. circle or triangle relative to their X/Y value

function.name: gtk_databox_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDatabox widget.

function.name: gtk_databox_pixel_to_value_x
function.description: Calculates the x value which is represented by the horizontal @pixel coordinate. Pixel coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the @box which is equivalent to (0,0).

function.name: gtk_databox_pixel_to_value_y
function.description: Calculates the y value which is represented by the vertical @pixel coordinate. Pixel coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the @box which is equivalent to (0,0).

function.name: gtk_databox_points_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDataboxPoints object which can be added to a #GtkDatabox widget.

parameter.name: X
parameter.parameter_description: array of horizontal position values of markers

parameter.name: Y
parameter.parameter_description: array of vertical position values of markers

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: marker size or line width (depending on the @type)

function.name: gtk_databox_ruler_get_max_length
function.description: This function returns the maximum number of digits to be used for each tick label of the @ruler.
function.return: The maximum length of the tick labels.

function.name: gtk_databox_ruler_get_orientation
function.description: Gets the orientation of the @ruler (horizontal or vertical).

function.name: gtk_databox_ruler_get_range
function.description: Retrieves values indicating the range and current position of a #GtkDataboxRuler. See gtk_databox_ruler_set_range().

parameter.name: lower
parameter.parameter_description: location to store lower limit of the ruler, or %NULL

parameter.name: upper
parameter.parameter_description: location to store upper limit of the ruler, or %NULL

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the current position of the mark on the ruler, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_databox_ruler_get_scale_type
function.description: This function returns the scale type of the @ruler (linear or logarithmic).

function.name: gtk_databox_ruler_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDataboxRuler widget with the given @orientation (horizontal or vertical).

function.name: gtk_databox_ruler_set_max_length
function.description:
This function sets the maximum number of digits to be used for each tick label of the @ruler.
The @max_length cannot be smaller than 2 and not bigger than #GTK_DATABOX_RULER_MAX_MAX_LENGTH.

function.name: gtk_databox_ruler_set_orientation
function.description: Sets the orientation of the @ruler (horizontal or vertical).

function.name: gtk_databox_ruler_set_range
function.description:
Sets values indicating the range and current position of a #GtkDataboxRuler.
See gtk_databox_ruler_get_range().

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: current position of the mark on the ruler

function.name: gtk_databox_ruler_set_scale_type
function.description: This function sets the scale type of the @ruler.

parameter.name: scale_type
parameter.parameter_description: The new scale type for @ruler (linear or logarithmic)

function.name: gtk_databox_set_adjustment_x
function.description: Setter function for the #GtkDatabox:adjustment-x property. Normally, it should not be required to use this function, see property documentation.

function.name: gtk_databox_set_adjustment_y
function.description: Setter function for the #GtkDatabox:adjustment-y property. Normally, it should not be required to use this function, see property documentation.

function.name: gtk_databox_set_enable_selection
function.description: Setter function for the #GtkDatabox:enable-selection property.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.parameter_description: Whether selection via mouse is enabled or not.

function.name: gtk_databox_set_enable_zoom
function.description: Setter function for the #GtkDatabox:enable-zoom property.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.parameter_description: Whether zoom via mouse is enabled or not.

function.name: gtk_databox_set_ruler_x
function.description: Setter function for the #GtkDatabox:ruler-x property.

function.name: gtk_databox_set_ruler_y
function.description: Setter function for the #GtkDatabox:ruler-y property.

function.name: gtk_databox_set_scale_type_x
function.description: Setter function for the #GtkDatabox:scale-type-x property.

function.name: gtk_databox_set_scale_type_y
function.description: Setter function for the #GtkDatabox:scale-type-y property.

function.name: gtk_databox_set_total_limits
function.description:
This function is used to set the limits of the total display area of @box. This function can be used to invert the orientation of the displayed graphs, e.g. @top=-1000 and @bottom=0.
Side effect: The @box also internally calls gtk_databox_set_visible_limits() with the same values.

function.name: gtk_databox_set_visible_limits
function.description:
This function is used to set the limits of the visible display area of @box. The visible display area can be section of the total area, i.e. the @box zooms in, showing only a part of the complete picture.
The orientation of the values have to be the same as in gtk_databox_set_total_limits() and the visible limits have to be within the total limits. The values will not be used otherwise.
Side effect: The @box emits #GtkDatabox::zoomed.

function.name: gtk_databox_value_to_pixel_x
function.description: Calculates the horizontal pixel coordinate which represents the x @value. Pixel coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the @box which is equivalent to (0,0).

function.name: gtk_databox_value_to_pixel_y
function.description: Calculates the vertical pixel coordinate which represents the y @value. Pixel coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the @box which is equivalent to (0,0).

function.name: gtk_databox_values_to_pixels
function.description: Calculates the pixel equivalents of the given X/Y values and stores them in the @pixels array.

function.name: gtk_databox_xyc_graph_get_X
function.description: Gets the X values of the @xzc_graph.

function.name: gtk_databox_xyc_graph_get_Y
function.description: Gets the Y values of the @xzc_graph.

function.name: gtk_databox_xyc_graph_get_length
function.description: Gets the the length of the X and Y values arrays.

function.name: gtk_databox_zoom_home
function.description:
This is equivalent to shift right-clicking into the @box.
This function works, if the attribute #enable-zoom is set to #TRUE. It is equivalent to calling the gtk_databox_set_visible_limits() with the total limits.

function.name: gtk_databox_zoom_out
function.description:
This is equivalent to right-clicking into the @box.
This function works, if the attribute #enable-zoom is set to #TRUE. Calling the function then zooms out by a factor of 2 in both dimensions (the maximum is defined by the total limits, see gtk_databox_set_total_limits()).
Side effect: The @box emits #GtkDatabox::zoomed.

function.name: gtk_databox_zoom_to_selection
function.description:
This is equivalent to left-clicking into the selected area.
This function works, if the attribute #enable-zoom is set to #TRUE. Calling the function then zooms to the area selected with the mouse.
Side effect: The @box emits #GtkDatabox::zoomed.
